availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Thompson (Kentucky, first lieut 53rd Mt Inf (U.S.A.))

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, tobacconist and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James W. Thompson and Susannah Thompson. Married to Malvina Thompson. Father of Jessie Thompson. Tobacconist in Kenton County in 1860. Served in the 53rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A). as first lieutenant from September 22, 1864, to September 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 2, p. 232A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 1, p. 519.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis, Ward 11, p. 463B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 521.
Missouri Death Records, 1850-1931, Jefferson City, MO, USA: Missouri State Archives, p. 160, p. 160 of 8225 of microfilm (accessed through ancestry.com on September 10, 2020).
